definition: threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams

sentences.english: On weekends, I'll catch the morning movie for my visual enjoyment.
sentences.chinese: 在周末时，俺都去看早场电影，享受视觉飨宴喜悦。

sentences.english: Let's go to see matinee movies.
I always go to matinees since they're a lot cheaper.
sentences.chinese: 我总是去看早场演出，因为价钱便宜很多。

sentences.english: Let's go to see matinee movies and save a few bucks.
sentences.chinese: 我们去看早场的电影省几块钱吧。

sentences.english: On learning that there were no buses, they decided to go to the early performances.
sentences.chinese: 得知没有公共汽车了，他们决定去看早场演出。

sentences.english: It is difficult when we come back after the international break and play an early kick off.
sentences.chinese: 在国际比赛之后，打一场早场的比赛很困难。

definition: the number of showings of a movie, play etc/screening/performance
to reserve all the seats (or a large block of seats) at a theater, restaurant etc
to try to answer a question (in a quiz, guessing game, riddle etc)/quiz game
